src:
Cierra Cuba con cuatro medallas en Mundial de lucha sub 23
02 Nov 2019, 17:33 by ACN

Con una cosecha de dos medallas de oro e igual cantidad de bronce, con cuatro competidores, cerró hoy Cuba su participación en el Campeonato Mundial de lucha de la categoría sub 23 años.

El primer cubano en subir al podio de premiaciones fue el gladiador del estilo libre Reineri Andreu, que conquistó la presea dorada de los 57 kilogramos en el Mundial, que concluirá mañana en Budapest, Hungría.Andreu, dueño de un metal áureo y un séptimo lugar en eventos de ese tipo, en las ediciones de 2017 y 2018, respectivamente, derrotó 10-0 por superioridad técnica en la gran final a Adlan Askarov, de Kazajistán.Con cuatro victorias se despidió de esa cita del orbe el talentoso atleta de la isla, que consiguió así su segundo título a ese nivel.Después, el librista Yonger Bastida (92 kg), medallista de plata en el certamen universal para juveniles de Tallin, Estonia, el pasado mes de agosto, aseguraría el bronce en su peso al derrotar 6-2 a Demur Megeneishvili, de Georgia.Entre las féminas, Milaymis de la Caridad Marín se encargaró de brindar más alegrías a la nación caribeña con la conquista del cetro en los 72 kilos.Marín, campeona en la lid de Tallin y monarca en los Juegos Olímpicos de la Juventud, de Buenos Aires 2018, se adueñó del oro al vencer 6-2 a la china Xiaoqian Wang.En ese combate final la luchadora de la isla comenzó debajo 0-2 en el marcador, pero supo remontar para imponerse con tres pases atrás, dos de ellos en los últimos segundos.La cosecha cubana la completó este sábado el exponente de la modalidad grecorromana Daniel Gregorich, con su bronce en los 87 kg.Gregorich, plateado en la segunda edición de ese torneo sub 23 el pasado año, tuvo un duro combate con el ruso Vaag Margarian, en pleito que terminó igualado a cinco puntos, pero al marcar en la última acción se llevó el triunfo.
text:
Sorna Sattari: Employment culture will destroy the confidence of the community

02 Nov 2019, 17:54

The vice president of science and technology said: "Employment culture in the country will destroy the confidence of society.
Speaking to Mehr news agency, Sorna Sattari said at a meeting on Saturday in a boom in manufacturing and the economy, that the culture of self-esteem is destroying confidence in society and that employment culture like oil is one of the most important problems in the country.
One of the ways to change the culture of employment is to create innovation factories, said the vice president of science and technology.
"Bringing out-of-ecosystem capacities to the province and being out of proportion with the ecosystem will cause problems in the province, including underdevelopment."
He noted that intrinsic and endogenous development is one of the issues we are pursuing, saying: "This issue should be examined based on the potential of each province and the ecosystem in it.
Sattari noted: Hormozgan has territorial potentials which, if viewed correctly, is a source of large capital production.
He said: The direction of industries operating in Hormozgan should be in the areas of the sea and in line with the province's ecosystem.
The Vice President of Science and Technology stated: One of the parts of creating an ecosystem in Hormozgan province is the belief and giving of youth and the activities of knowledge-based companies in the capacity of the province.
Noting that city-based companies should be responsible for municipal services and that the municipality be the sole supervisor, Sattari said, "Smart City is an opportunity provided by knowledge-based companies because the smart city is based on providing the municipality with services. The private sector.
He said: There are big industries in Hormozgan province that need a lot of services and if the services of these industries are not provided, they will meet their needs from outside the province.
"The task of the government is to participate in the construction of infrastructure to reduce the risk of privatization," said the vice president of science and technology.
Sattari considered the establishment of Hormozgan Research and Technology Fund one of the necessities of the province and said: The lack of research and technology fund is one of the backwardness of Hormozgan which should be seriously followed up.
He explained: Research and Technology Fund will be very effective for startup companies in Hormozgan province.
The Vice President of Science and Technology stated: The Vice President of Science and Technology is ready to provide part of the capital of the Research and Technology Fund for establishment.
Sattari noted: 5 times the amount of capital invested in shareholders' research and technology funds will be allocated to the province through a credit line.
"Unfortunately, there is no powerful accelerator in Hormozgan province to invest in youth creative ideas," Sattari said.
The vice president of science and technology stated: "The product that is delivered to the people must be made by the private sector and if not, it will lead to public dissatisfaction."
